business.headline: World's richest race: Elon Musk reclaims No.1 spot from Larry EllisonElon Musk has largely remained at the top of the global wealth chart since first claiming the position in 2021. Though he was overtaken briefly by LVMH's Bernard Arnault in 2021 and by Amazon founder Jeff Bezos in 2024.

Donald Trump's hot-and-cold tariff game: Why India must avoid a 'MASALA' dealDonald Trump is giving India mixed signals on trade and tariffs, hot one moment and cold the next. The risk? Falling for MASALA deals. Read to know what they are, and why India must resist.
Sensex, Nifty gain after flat opening amid US rate cut optimismThe S&P BSE Sensex gained over 100 points after a flat start, while the NSE Nifty50 briefly crossed the 25,000 mark.

3 IPOs in focus: Urban Company leads, but where's the bigger listing gain?Urban Company's was fully subscribed within a few hours, indicating high demand. Alongside Urban Company, two other IPOs, Dev Accelerator and Shringar House of Mangalsutra, are also open for bidding this week.

Oracle's Larry Ellison surpasses Elon Musk to become world's richest personEllison's net worth jumped by an unprecedented $101 billion in a single day after Oracle Corp. delivered blowout quarterly results, sparking a record surge in its stock.

From 20s to retirement: How bonds strengthen your financesBonds don't grab headlines like stocks, but they quietly strengthen your finances across life stages. From building discipline in your 20s to ensuring stability in retirement, they remain a steady anchor for wealth creation. Here's how they work for you.
Document shows India resisting complete crypto regulation: ReportWhile some countries like Japan and Australia are developing frameworks to regulate digital assets carefully, India remains cautious.

Sensex, Nifty extend gains on US trade deal hopes and Fed rate cut buzzThe NSE Nifty 50 climbed 104.50 points to close at 24,973.10, while the BSE Sensex added 323.83 points, ending at 81,425.15. The Nifty has now gained for six straight sessions, with the Sensex rising in five of the last six trading days.

Festive season stocks that you should add to your portfolioWith people ready to spend on home appliances, beauty products, lifestyle goods, and automobiles, investors are now looking for stocks that could benefit from this surge in demand.

Is your credit score falling? Here's how to fix itHas your credit score recently taken a hit? You're not alone. Many people discover a drop only when applying for a loan or credit card. The good news is, most reasons are easy to fix with a few smart steps.

Fitch raises India's growth forecast to 6.9% for FY26 on strong Q2 performanceThe revision comes after India's real GDP grew by 7.8% in the April–to-June quarter, surpassing expectations and marking an acceleration from the 7.4% growth seen in the previous three months.

Delhi High Court asks Priya Kapur to list Sunjay Kapur's assetsThe legal dispute over the estate of the late businessman Sanjay Kapoor has reached the Delhi High Court. A suit has been filed by Karishma Kapoor's two children, who claim they are entitled to their father's personal assets as legal heirs. The High Court has registered the suit and will hear the matter on the 9th of October to decide on an interim stay. The children contend they have been informed they are not beneficiaries under Sanjay Kapoor's will, which they are now questioning and allege has been forged. In response, Priya Kapoor's counsel has told the court that the children "have already been given 1900 crore worth of assets six days before the suit was even filed." The Delhi High Court has directed Priya Kapoor to file a list of all movable and immovable assets of Sanjay Kapoor known to her.

This crypto exchange eyes $3 billion IPO with Nasdaq backingThe company, backed by the Winklevoss twins, plans to sell 16.67 million shares at a price between $24 and $26 each, up from its previous range of $17 to $19 per share.

Why affordable housing demand is slowing down in IndiaAffordable housing was once the backbone of India's housing dream, offering budget-friendly options to urban families. But today, demand in this segment is slipping, as buyers increasingly feel these homes don't match their needs.

Can Karisma Kapoor's children get a part of Sunjay Kapur's Rs 30,000 crore empire?The lawsuit from Karisma Kapoor's children accuses their stepmother Priya Sachdeva of withholding critical information and details about Sunjay Kapur's will. The hearing for this case is scheduled for today, September 10, 2025.

Court asks Priya Kapur to list Sunjay Kapur's assets after lawsuitDelhi High Court has asked Priya Sachdev Kapur to submit a detailed list of all movable and immovable assets belonging to the late Sunjay Kapur.

Tax on gold jewellery? Here's all you need to knowWondering if your gold jewellery attracts income tax? The answer depends on whether you simply own it or decide to sell it. Here's a quick look at how the tax rules work in India.

Novo Nordisk cuts 9,000 jobs to save $1.26 billion annuallyThe company, which employs nearly 78,400 people globally, said around 5,000 of the job losses will take place in Denmark. The decision comes as Novo faces increasing pressure from its US rival Eli Lilly and slowing demand for Wegovy in key markets.

IT stocks rally big on Fed cut optimism Where to invest nowThe main driver behind IT sector rally is growing hope that the US Federal Reserve will cut interest rates soon. Lower rates would reduce costs for global businesses and boost demand for IT services.

What are homebuyers most worried about in 2025? Hint: It's not just priceThe 2025 housing market signals a clear shift. Buyers are moving beyond affordability, prioritising quality, timely delivery, and livability, even if it means paying more for premium and luxury homes.

Sensex up nearly 400 points, Nifty nears 25,000 on hopes of India-US trade talksThe S&P BSE Sensex rose over 350 points in early trade, while the Nifty50 edged close to the 25,000 mark around 9:30 am. Both indices reflected improved sentiment after five straight sessions of gains.

Urban Company IPO open for bidding today: Should you invest as GMP doubles?Ahead of the public subscription, Urban Company raised Rs 854 crore from anchor investors. Notable institutions participating in the anchor round included Government Pension Fund Global, Nomura Funds Ireland, etc.

Oracle cuts over 100 jobs in India as AI reshapes workforceOracle, which employs around 30,000 people in India, reported a revenue of Rs 20,459 crore in the year ended March 2024, a 20% jump from the previous year.

Backpacking on a budget: Smart forex tips for young travellersFor young backpackers, every rupee counts. While cheap flights and hostels often top the checklist, the way you manage foreign exchange could quietly decide whether your trip stays on budget, or slips into overspending.

Hyderabad on track to become a global tech hub: D Sridhar BabuHyderabad is aiming to become a global technology hub, focusing on innovation, start-ups, and talent development. At the India Today Conclave South 2025, D Sridhar Babu, Minister for IT, E&C, Industries & Commerce, outlined the city's vision.
Sensex ends 314 points higher, Nifty above 24,850; Infosys gains 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 314.02 points to close at 81,101.32, while the NSE Nifty50 added 95.45 points to end at 24,868.60.

Karisma Kapoor's children vs stepmother Priya in lawsuit over Sunjay Kapur's willSunjay Kapur's children, identified as the legal heirs, have filed a suit in Delhi High Court seeking partition of the estate, rendition of accounts, and a permanent injunction

Hyderabad aims to become a global technology hub, says D Sridhar BabuHyderabad, according to  D Sridhar Babu, is positioning itself as a global technology and innovation hub, with a strong focus on AI, start-ups, industry, and skill development, while aiming to balance economic growth with social welfare.

Ericsson lays off 100 Canadian employees amid global restructuringEricsson has confirmed that about 100 of its Canadian staff will lose their jobs as the company continues to restructure its workforce worldwide.
How can ease of business be improved in India's real estate sector?

The PF problem: Why so many employees struggle to access their own moneyEvery month, employees across India save a part of their salary in the Provident Fund. But system errors, bureaucratic delays, and glitches mean that for millions, claiming their own PF money has become a frustrating challenge.

How can India achieve affordable housing? Tata Realty CEO explainsSanjay Dutt, Managing Director and CEO of Tata Realty & Infrastructure Ltd, spoke about how India can work towards making affordable housing more accessible and practical.

From Agarwals to Patels: Which surnames rule India's richest family businesses?Behind India's richest family businesses lies an interesting pattern, certain surnames appear again and again. The Hurun India Rich List 2025 reveals which surnames dominate this legacy of wealth, with Agarwals, Guptas and Jains leading the pack.

Selling property? Here are 9 smart ways to save on capital gains taxSelling property can bring you a good profit, but it often comes with the worry of paying a hefty capital gains tax. Luckily, the Income Tax Act offers several ways to cut down or even avoid this tax if you plan wisely.

Cash, gold, property: How to protect your wedding gifts from tax troubleMost of these gifts are legally tax-free. Under Section 56(2)(x) of the Income Tax Act, gifts received by the bride or groom on the occasion of marriage are completely exempt from tax.

Amanta Healthcare IPO lists at 7% premium on stock market debutAmanta Healthcare share price: The pharmaceutical company listed at Rs 135 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), giving investors a 7.14% premium over the issue price of Rs 126.

Gold hits all-time high of Rs 1,10,000 per 10 grams. Why is it rallying today?On the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX), gold futures for December delivery jumped Rs 458, or 0.41%, to Rs 1,10,047 per 10 grams. The most-traded October contract also touched a lifetime high of Rs 1,09,000 per 10 grams, gaining Rs 482.

Why are Infosys and other IT stocks rallying? Here is all you need to knowInfosys was the star performer. Its shares rose 3.4% after the company said its board will meet on September 11 to consider a share buyback.
Explained: Why Infosys shares jumped 4% today The stock was trading 3.88% higher at Rs 1,488.25 around 9:45 am on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).
Sensex, Nifty rise amid rising hopes of US rate cut; IT stocks lead rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex added 315.61 points to 81,102.91, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 82 points to 24,855.15, as of 9:32 am.

entertainment.headline: Kishwer Merchant calls Bigg Boss 19 boring, fans hit backKishwer Merchant has called Bigg Boss 19 boring, sparking a fierce debate among fans who defend the current season as better than her own.

Badshah wins hearts after bowing to elderly fan, dedicating song at US concertSinger-rapper Badshah's adorable gesture for an elderly fan at the US concert has left fans praising him. A video from the concert has gone viral.

Tanishaa Mukerji recalls memory loss after near-fatal accident on debut film shootActor Tanishaa Mukerji recalled her near-fatal accident on debut film 'Ssssshhh....' shoot. She revealed suffering from a concussion and memory loss.

Selena Gomez blushes talking about wedding with Benny Blanco, reveals ring bearerActor Selena Gomez recently revealed details about her wedding plans with fiance Benny Blanco, teasing that the preparations were going well.

Manoj Bajpayee in splits as Jaideep, Anurag touch his feet at Jugnuma screeningActor Manoj Bajpayee found himself in a humorous situation at 'Jugnuma's' premiere. Jaideep Ahlawat, Anurag Kashyap, Vijay Varma and others playfully touched Bajpayee's feet and left him embarrassed.

Salman Khan looks ripped in military uniform at Battle of Galwan shoot. See picA new picture of Salman Khan from the 'Battle of Galwan' shoot in Ladakh has emerged, showcasing his physical transformation for the role of Colonel B Santosh Babu. The film is directed by Apoorva Lakhia.

Sunita Ahuja recalls Govinda flirted with co-stars: Only Sonali Bendre was sparedSunita Ahuja appeared as a guest judge on 'Pati Patni Aur Panga' and shared fun insights about her actor-husband Govinda. She revealed Govinda flirted with many co-actors but never with Sonali Bendre, adding a nostalgic touch to the show.

Actor Mohini says she was forced to do intimate scene in Kanmani despite discomfortActor Mohini revealed she was forced to perform intimate scenes in 'Kanmani' without her consent. She admitted that she was pressureised to shoot a swimsuit scene despite her discomfort.

My Youth review: Song Joong-ki returns with slow burn K-drama not for everyoneRelease Date:Fri Sep 05, 2025'My Youth' is a slow-burn romance K-drama starring Song Joong-ki and Chun Woo-hee. The series blends nostalgia with intimate storytelling, offering a soothing watch for romance fans.

Modern Family star Eric Stonestreet marries his longtime partner Lindsay SchweitzerEric Stonestreet, famed for his role in 'Modern Family', is married to his long-time girlfriend Lindsay Schweitzer in an intimate ceremony at their Kansas City home. The couple shared joyous moments on social media.

Gauri Pradhan reunites with ex-actor friend, now industry head at Google IndiaGauri Pradhan recently met her long-time friend Mayoori Kango, now a Google India executive. Their reunion highlights Mayoori's journey from Bollywood to a successful corporate career, demonstrating significant transitions in her professional life.

Rajinikanth congratulates Sivakarthikeyan for Madharaasi: Excellent action, loved itTamil actor Sivakarthikeyan, whose latest film 'Madhaarasi' is currently running in theatres, shared the special message he got from his idol Rajinikanth on X.

Director Anuparna Roy stands by Palestine remarks: Doesn't make me less IndianAnuparna Roy's debut film 'Songs of Forgotten Trees' won Best Director at the Venice Film Festival, marking a proud moment for Indian cinema. The young filmmaker shared her challenging journey and heartfelt gratitude towards the support from industry stalwarts like Anurag Kashyap and fellow Bollywood colleagues.

Maheep, Bhavana say no to Bijuria dance, KJo turns to Varun-Janhvi for tipsFilmmaker Karan Johar shared a video of Maheep Kapoor and Bhavana Pandey declining to dance to 'Bijuria'. The request was made in an Instagram post termed 'reluctant nepo moms'. The post also referenced Varun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor for potential dance lessons.

Kunickaa Sadanand's son Ayaan says her relationship with Kumar Sanu was very toxicActor Ayaan Lall opened up about his mother Kunickaa Sadanand's relationship with singer Kumar Sanu. He clarified the timeline and describes the relationship as toxic, shedding light on her post-divorce life.

Demon Slayer Infinity Castle: A beginner's guide to the world-class anime hitWith 'Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle' releasing soon, fans in India can catch up by watching just a few key episodes instead of the entire series. The film has already set records with advance bookings and early morning screenings, promising an exciting experience for anime lovers.

Is Shehbaz Badesha's entry into Bigg Boss 19 a low-key TV nepotism moment?Shehbaz Badesha, brother of actor Shehnaaz Gill, is the first wild card contestant of 'Bigg Boss 19'. He made a brief appearance in the reality show's 13th season to support his sister. But does he deserve to be in this season?

After Aishwarya, Abhishek Bachchan files plea on misuse of personality rightsAfter Aishwarya Rai, Abhishek Bachchan moved Delhi Court over personal rights protection.  He wants a ban on the unauthorised use of his images, name, voice, and performances.

Kunickaa gets support from 'doodhwala community', actor's son shares proofBigg Boss 19's Kunickaa Sadanand faced criticism inside the house but received unexpected support from the local 'doodhwala community.' Her son Ayaan Lall showcased this backing by sharing a video of milkmen rallying behind her.

general news.headline: Netanyahu invokes 9/11 to defend Doha strike: We did exactly what US didIsraeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu defends recent military actions in Doha, likening them to US measures after September 11. His remarks stress the need for nations to confront terrorism or let Israel do so.

Gunshot, screams, panic: Video captures moment Charlie Kirk was shot deadCharlie Kirk, founder of Turning Point USA, was answering a question about gun violence when a single gunshot rang out. As he abruptly slumped in his seat, chaos broke out.

We can help you address racism: India schools Switzerland over minority remarkKshitij Tyagi's remarks came a day after Switzerland called on India to "take effective measures to protect the minorities and uphold the rights to the freedom of expression and the freedom of the media."

Biden was driven by ego for 2024 re-election bid: Kamala Harris's bombshellIn her upcoming memoir 107 Days, former US Vice President Kamala Harris delivers her sharpest critique of Joe Biden, calling his 2024 re-election bid "reckless" and driven by ego rather than duty.

Donald Trump's hot-and-cold tariff game: Why India must avoid a 'MASALA' dealDonald Trump is giving India mixed signals on trade and tariffs, hot one moment and cold the next. The risk? Falling for MASALA deals. Read to know what they are, and why India must resist.

Have very good impression of Modi Ji, says Nepal's ex-Chief Justice Sushila KarkiFormer Chief Justice Sushila Karki accepted Nepal's interim PM role after Gen-Z protests ousted the government, vowing to honor slain youth, rebuild Nepal, and strengthen India ties while praising PM Modi.

How Shivam Dube is taking on IPL's all-rounder killer ruleThe IPL's 'all-rounder killer' rule has clipped his bowling wings, but with backing from the Indian team management, Shivam Dube is finding room to work on his secondary skill. In the Asia Cup opener against the UAE, Dube took three wickets in an encouraging two-over spell in Dubai.

How Pakistan has become opium capital of the world with Afghan expertiseSprawling poppy fields in Pakistan's Balochistan have overtaken those in Afghanistan, which produced 80% of the world's opium. The Taliban's 2022 ban on poppy farming in Afghanistan pushed cultivators into Pakistan. With Afghan expertise and share-croppers, Pakistan has become the world's new opium hub.

Meet Tejasvi Manoj, 17-year-old Indian-origin girl named TIME's Kid of the YearTejasvi Manoj, an Indian origin girl recognised as TIME's Kid of the Year 2025, created Shield Seniors to help older adults navigate online safely.

Physiotherapists not doctors, can't use 'Dr' prefix: Government's health authorityThe Directorate General of Health Services said that physiotherapists are not trained as medical doctors and should not present themselves as such.

Trump ally Charlie Kirk shot dead on stage; door-to-door search for assassinCharlie Kirk, founder of Turning Point USA and staunch Trump ally, was shot dead at a Utah campus event. He was known for fiery Christian nationalist rhetoric and mobilising young conservatives.

Novak Djokovic shifts family to Greece as Serbian protests intensify: ReportsNovak Djokovic has quietly relocated his family to Greece amid growing political pressure in Serbia. This move follows his open support for student protests and signals increasing tensions with the Serbian government.

I'm an obesity doctor and here's my realistic, guilt-free guide to weight lossIn this DocYard column, renowned bariatric surgeon Dr. Muffazal Ladkawala explains the actual reason behind obesity and how small habits and the right mindset can help one manage weight amid a busy schedule.

Violation of sovereignty: In call with Qatar's Emir, PM condemns strikes on DohaQatar is a key US ally and a mediator in the Gaza peace talks. The attacks on Doha took place at a time when several Hamas leaders were in the city to participate in the US-backed ceasefire talks.

Seated for 2 hours, passengers deplaned from Air India flight due to faulty ACThe Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner aircraft was scheduled to depart from Delhi at 11 pm on Wednesday night. The passengers were seated for almost two hours before being asked to deboard the plane.

Symbol of harmony, societal change: PM praises Mohan Bhagwat on 75th birthdayPrime Minister Narendra Modi marked RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's 75th birthday with praise for his lifelong service and dedication to harmony, also writing an op-ed on his leadership.

Is motherhood off-limits for women facing mental health issues?Is your mental health condition casting a major question mark over your desire to become a mother? Perhaps this article will help you come to a conclusion.

Charlie Kirk: Proud dropout, political provocateur and Trump confidanteCharlie Kirk made his name sparring with college students in open-air debates on issues ranging from transgender rights to climate policy. Trump valued the popular podcaster as an adviser with a strong feel for the Republican youth base.

World's richest race: Elon Musk reclaims No.1 spot from Larry EllisonElon Musk has largely remained at the top of the global wealth chart since first claiming the position in 2021. Though he was overtaken briefly by LVMH's Bernard Arnault in 2021 and by Amazon founder Jeff Bezos in 2024.

Apple admits picking iPhone Air over 17 Pro is hard, reveals who its thinnest iPhone is forApple has introduced a new twist to its iPhone line-up this year by launching the iPhone 17 Pro alongside an all-new model called the iPhone Air. The company is openly suggesting that it wants buyers to face a real dilemma, whether to pick the powerful Pro or the ultra-thin Air.

Reddit debates toxic work culture after Bengaluru woman types away in theatreAddressing the "chaotic" work culture in the Karnataka capital, the user wrote on the subreddit r/Bangalore: "Only in Bangalore! Went to watch Lokah movie and a woman in the row ahead opened her laptop and started working like she's in office, typing away, in a theatre."

Cook earning Rs 10,000 forced into legal battle after Rs 40 crore tax noticeRavindra Singh Chauhan, a dhaba cook from Gwalior earning Rs 10,000 a month, was stunned to learn that transactions worth over Rs 40 crore had been carried out through a company and bank account opened in his name without his knowledge.

Hindu king's portrait behind Nepal Army chief. Is there a message?When Nepal Army chief, General Ashok Raj Sigdel, addressed a restless nation on Tuesday, it wasn't just his call for peace that was important. A portrait of King Prithvi Narayan Shah hung prominently behind him. Is there a message behind the image of the Hindu king, founder of Nepal's Shah dynasty?

iPhone 17 is here and it's time to discuss the great smartphone scamWhether you're Team Apple or Team Android, you're all suckers in this grand smartphone scam. These devices promise connection but deliver isolation: one notification at a time. So next time you pull out your precious gadget, remember: it's not a status symbol, it's a shiny leash.

sports.headline: Asia Cup 2025: UAE head coach admits batters were overawed by India starsUAE head coach Lalchand Rajput admitted his batters were overawed by India's stars after a nine-wicket defeat in the Asia Cup 2025 opener. After huge SA20 auction, South Africa edge past England in rain-marred 1st T20ISouth Africa defeated England by 14 runs in a rain-affected first T20I at Cardiff on Wednesday. The win came just after the record-breaking SA20 auction where Dewald Brevis shattered records.

Riding on hat-trick win, Bangladesh look for clinical start vs Hong KongBangladesh face Hong Kong in a crucial Asia Cup Group B clash in Abu Dhabi. Hong Kong will be looking to bounce back from their defeat to Afghanistan, while the Tigers aim for a winning start at the Sheikh Zayed Stadium.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
